Situation1: Help each other in times of need or emotional distress.
Situation2: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Story: I stared at my phone, torn. My sister’s text was desperate—she’d just broken up with her boyfriend and wanted me to come over. She never asked for help unless she really needed it. At the same time, my girlfriend was waiting for me at the café, her suitcase already packed for her move abroad. This was our last weekend together for months, and we’d planned every moment. She’d been counting on me to make it special, to show her how much I’d miss her. My sister, though, was alone and hurting, and I’d always promised to be there for her no matter what. I could feel the weight of both their expectations pressing down on me, my heart pulled in two directions. I wanted to be the brother who never let his sister down, and the boyfriend who made his partner feel cherished. But I couldn’t be both at once. My hands shook as I tried to decide who needed me more.
